newsitem.title: USA: US LPG market steady in light pre-holiday trade.
newsitem.headline: US LPG market steady in light pre-holiday trade.

text.p: U.S. spot liquefied petroleum gas prices remained steady in light pre-holiday talk that looked likely to peter out by midday, traders said.
"If the brokers are going home after lunch, not much is going to happen later," said one trader in Houston.
Still a few deals were heard done in the Mont Belvieu, Texas market including propane 35.75 a gallon.
Also, butane traded at 41.50 cents a gallon, and ethane mix was done at 20.75 cents a gallon.
Prices were also steady in the Conway, Kansas market, were talk was also decidedly subdued, traders said.
-- Oliver Ludwig New York Energy Desk +1 212 859 1633
